tool.name: PeptideIndexer
tool.description: Refreshes the protein references for all peptide hits.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && #if $fasta: mkdir fasta && ln -s '$fasta' 'fasta/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $fasta.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($fasta.ext)' && #end if mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' #if $fasta: -fasta 'fasta/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $fasta.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($fasta.ext)' #end if -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: Input idXML file containing the identifications
Input sequence database in FASTA format
param.help: Leave empty for using the same DB as used for the input idXML (this might fail). Non-existing relative filenames are looked up via 'OpenMS.ini:id_db_dir' select fasta data sets(s)

param.label: String that was appended (or prefixed - see 'decoy_string_position' flag below) to the accessions in the protein database to indicate decoy proteins
param.help: If empty (default), it's determined automatically (checking for common terms, both as prefix and suffix)

param.label: Is the 'decoy_string' prepended (prefix) or appended (suffix) to the protein accession

Action to take if NO peptide was assigned to a decoy protein (which indicates wrong database or decoy string): 'error' (exit with error, no output), 'warn' (exit with success, warning message), 'silent' (no action is taken, not even a warning)
If set, the protein sequences are stored as well
If set, the protein description is stored as well
If set, protein hits which are not referenced by any peptide are kept
If peptide sequences cannot be matched to any protein: 1) raise an error; 2) warn (unmatched PepHits will miss target/decoy annotation with downstream problems); 3) remove the hit
Maximal number of ambiguous amino acids (AAAs) allowed when matching to a protein database with AAAs
Maximal number of mismatched (mm) amino acids allowed when matching to a protein database
param.help: The required runtime is exponential in the number of mm's; apply with care. MM's are allowed in addition to AAA's

param.label: Treat the isobaric amino acids isoleucine ('I') and leucine ('L') as equivalent (indistinguishable)
param.help: Also occurrences of 'J' will be treated as 'I' thus avoiding ambiguous matching

param.label: Enzyme which determines valid cleavage sites -
param.help: e.g. trypsin cleaves after lysine (K) or arginine (R), but not before proline (P). Default: deduce from input

param.label: Specificity of the enzyme
param.help: Default: deduce from input.. 'full': both internal cleavage sites must match.. 'semi': one of two internal cleavage sites must match.. 'none': allow all peptide hits no matter their context (enzyme is irrelevant)

param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Refreshes the protein references for all peptide hits.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/nightly/html/TOPP_PeptideIndexer.html
